content.content:
1→# claude-proxy
     2→
     3→A cross-platform CLI tool that wraps Claude CLI to provide real-time progress feedback during headless execution by parsing streaming JSON output.
     4→
     5→## Features
     6→
     7→- Real-time progress updates showing what Claude is doing
     8→- Colored output with emoji indicators
     9→- Three verbosity levels: quiet, normal, and verbose
    10→- Automatic TTY detection for script-friendly piped output
    11→- Cross-platform support (Windows, macOS, Linux)
    12→- Graceful shutdown on Ctrl+C
    13→
    14→## Project Structure
    15→
    16→claude-proxy follows the standard Go project layout:
    17→
    18→```
    19→claude-proxy/
    20→├── cmd/claude-proxy/    # Application entry point
    21→├── internal/            # Private application packages
    22→│   ├── cli/            # Command-line flags
    23→│   ├── config/         # Configuration management
    24→│   ├── detect/         # Claude CLI auto-detection
    25→│   ├── events/         # Event parsing
    26→│   ├── output/         # Display formatting
    27→│   └── runner/         # Process execution
    28→├── make.py            # Cross-platform build automation (psutil, uv-managed)
    29→└── CONTRIBUTING.md    # Development guide
    30→```
    31→
    32→See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for detailed package descriptions.
    33→
    34→## Installation
    35→
    36→### Download Pre-built Binary
    37→
    38→Download the appropriate binary for your platform from the releases page:
    39→
    40→| Platform | Binary |
    41→|----------|--------|
    42→| Windows (64-bit) | `claude-proxy-windows-amd64.exe` |
    43→| macOS (Intel) | `claude-proxy-darwin-amd64` |
    44→| macOS (Apple Silicon) | `claude-proxy-darwin-arm64` |
    45→| Linux (64-bit) | `claude-proxy-linux-amd64` |
    46→
    47→### Add to PATH
    48→
    49→#### Windows
    50→
    51→1. Move `claude-proxy-windows-amd64.exe` to a directory (e.g., `C:\Tools`)
    52→2. Rename to `claude-proxy.exe` for convenience
    53→3. Add the directory to your PATH environment variable
    54→
    55→#### macOS/Linux
    56→
    57→```bash
    58→# Move to a directory in your PATH
    59→sudo mv claude-proxy-darwin-arm64 /usr/local/bin/claude-proxy
    60→
    61→# Make it executable
    62→sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/claude-proxy
    63→```
    64→
    65→### Build from Source
    66→
    67→Requires Go 1.21+ and Python 3.12+ (or [uv](https://github.com/astral-sh/uv)).
    68→
    69→```bash
    70→# Clone the repository
    71→git clone https://github.com/peakflames/claude-proxy.git
    72→cd claude-proxy
    73→
    74→# Using uv (recommended)
    75→uv run make.py build
    76→
    77→# Using Python directly
    78→python make.py build
    79→
    80→# Or build directly with Go
    81→go build -o claude-proxy ./cmd/claude-proxy
    82→
    83→# Build for all platforms
    84→uv run make.py build-all
    85→
    86→# Process management (headless execution)
    87→uv run make.py start "your prompt"  # Build and start in background
    88→uv run make.py status               # Check if running
    89→uv run make.py log                  # View output logs
    90→uv run make.py stop                 # Stop background process
    91→```
    92→
    93→For detailed development instructions, see [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md).
    94→
    95→## Usage
    96→
    97→### Running from Source
    98→
    99→After building, run directly from the project directory:
   100→
   101→```bash
   102→# Windows (Git Bash, PowerShell, or CMD)
   103→./claude-proxy.exe "What is the capital of France?"
   104→
   105→# macOS/Linux
   106→./claude-proxy "What is the capital of France?"
   107→```
   108→
   109→Or use the build script for common workflows:
   110→```bash
   111→uv run make.py run                      # Build + run test prompt (foreground)
   112→uv run make.py start "your prompt"      # Build + run in background
   113→```
   114→
   115→### Running from PATH
   116→
   117→If you've installed to GOPATH/bin or moved the binary to your PATH:
   118→
   119→```bash
   120→claude-proxy 'your prompt here'
   121→```
   122→
   123→### Examples
   124→
   125→```bash
   126→# Simple prompt
   127→claude-proxy 'What is the capital of France?'
   128→
   129→# Multi-word prompts
   130→claude-proxy 'Explain how binary search works'
   131→
   132→# With flags
   133→claude-proxy --verbose 'List files in this directory'
   134→claude-proxy --quiet 'Generate a UUID'
   135→```
   136→
   137→## Command-line Flags
   138→
   139→| Flag | Description |
   140→|------|-------------|
   141→| `--verbose` | Enable detailed output (shows tool parameters, results, token usage) |
   142→| `--quiet` | Enable minimal output (only errors and final result) |
   143→| `--no-color` | Disable colored output |
   144→| `--no-emoji` | Disable emoji in output |
   145→| `--config` | Path to config file (default: `~/.claude-proxy-config.json`) |
   146→
   147→## Configuration
   148→
   149→claude-proxy stores its configuration in `~/.claude-proxy-config.json`. The file is created automatically on first run.
   150→
   151→### Example Configuration
   152→
   153→```json
   154→{
   155→  "claudePath": "/usr/local/bin/claude",
   156→  "defaultVerbosity": "normal",
   157→  "colorEnabled": true,
   158→  "emojiEnabled": true
   159→}
   160→```
   161→
   162→### Configuration Options
   163→
   164→| Option | Type | Default | Description |
   165→|--------|------|---------|-------------|
   166→| `claudePath` | string | (auto-detected) | Path to Claude CLI executable |
   167→| `defaultVerbosity` | string | `"normal"` | Default verbosity level: `"quiet"`, `"normal"`, or `"verbose"` |
   168→| `colorEnabled` | boolean | `true` | Enable colored output |
   169→| `emojiEnabled` | boolean | `true` | Enable emoji indicators |
   170→
   171→## Output Modes
   172→
   173→### Normal Mode (default)
   174→
   175→Shows real-time progress with tool indicators:
   176→
   177→```
   178→Starting Claude...
   179→Reading file main.go
   180→Running command: go build
   181→Writing file output.txt
   182→Hello! I've completed the task.
   183→
   184→Session complete: 3 turns, 5.2s total (4.1s API), $0.02
   185→```
   186→
   187→### Verbose Mode (`--verbose`)
   188→
   189→Shows detailed information including tool parameters, results, and token usage:
   190→
   191→```
   192→Starting Claude...
   193→[Session] ID: abc123, Model: claude-sonnet-4-20250514
   194→Reading file main.go
   195→  path: /home/user/project/main.go
   196→  result: (178 lines)
   197→Running command: go build
   198→  command: go build -o app .
   199→  result: exit code 0
   200→...
   201→[Tokens] Input: 1,234 | Output: 567 | Cache Read: 890
   202→```
   203→
   204→### Quiet Mode (`--quiet`)
   205→
   206→Minimal output for scripts - only shows errors and final result:
   207→
   208→```
   209→Starting...
   210→Hello! I've completed the task.
   211→Done
   212→```
   213→
   214→## Example Output
   215→
   216→<!-- TODO: Add screenshot showing claude-proxy in action -->
   217→
   218→*Screenshot placeholder: Example showing claude-proxy running with colored output and progress indicators*
   219→
   220→## Requirements
   221→
   222→- Claude CLI must be installed and accessible in your PATH
   223→- Get Claude CLI from: https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-cli
   224→
   225→## License
   226→
   227→MIT
   228→

file.content:
# claude-proxy

A cross-platform CLI tool that wraps Claude CLI to provide real-time progress feedback during headless execution by parsing streaming JSON output.

## Features

- Real-time progress updates showing what Claude is doing
- Colored output with emoji indicators
- Three verbosity levels: quiet, normal, and verbose
- Automatic TTY detection for script-friendly piped output
- Cross-platform support (Windows, macOS, Linux)
- Graceful shutdown on Ctrl+C

## Project Structure

claude-proxy follows the standard Go project layout:

```
claude-proxy/
├── cmd/claude-proxy/    # Application entry point
├── internal/            # Private application packages
│   ├── cli/            # Command-line flags
│   ├── config/         # Configuration management
│   ├── detect/         # Claude CLI auto-detection
│   ├── events/         # Event parsing
│   ├── output/         # Display formatting
│   └── runner/         # Process execution
├── make.py            # Cross-platform build automation (psutil, uv-managed)
└── CONTRIBUTING.md    # Development guide
```

See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for detailed package descriptions.

## Installation

### Download Pre-built Binary

Download the appropriate binary for your platform from the releases page:

| Platform | Binary |
|----------|--------|
| Windows (64-bit) | `claude-proxy-windows-amd64.exe` |
| macOS (Intel) | `claude-proxy-darwin-amd64` |
| macOS (Apple Silicon) | `claude-proxy-darwin-arm64` |
| Linux (64-bit) | `claude-proxy-linux-amd64` |

### Add to PATH

#### Windows

1. Move `claude-proxy-windows-amd64.exe` to a directory (e.g., `C:\Tools`)
2. Rename to `claude-proxy.exe` for convenience
3. Add the directory to your PATH environment variable

#### macOS/Linux

```bash
# Move to a directory in your PATH
sudo mv claude-proxy-darwin-arm64 /usr/local/bin/claude-proxy

# Make it executable
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/claude-proxy
```

### Build from Source

Requires Go 1.21+ and Python 3.12+ (or [uv](https://github.com/astral-sh/uv)).

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/peakflames/claude-proxy.git
cd claude-proxy

# Using uv (recommended)
uv run make.py build

# Using Python directly
python make.py build

# Or build directly with Go
go build -o claude-proxy ./cmd/claude-proxy

# Build for all platforms
uv run make.py build-all

# Process management (headless execution)
uv run make.py start "your prompt"  # Build and start in background
uv run make.py status               # Check if running
uv run make.py log                  # View output logs
uv run make.py stop                 # Stop background process
```

For detailed development instructions, see [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md).

## Usage

### Running from Source

After building, run directly from the project directory:

```bash
# Windows (Git Bash, PowerShell, or CMD)
./claude-proxy.exe "What is the capital of France?"

# macOS/Linux
./claude-proxy "What is the capital of France?"
```

Or use the build script for common workflows:
```bash
uv run make.py run                      # Build + run test prompt (foreground)
uv run make.py start "your prompt"      # Build + run in background
```

### Running from PATH

If you've installed to GOPATH/bin or moved the binary to your PATH:

```bash
claude-proxy 'your prompt here'
```

### Examples

```bash
# Simple prompt
claude-proxy 'What is the capital of France?'

# Multi-word prompts
claude-proxy 'Explain how binary search works'

# With flags
claude-proxy --verbose 'List files in this directory'
claude-proxy --quiet 'Generate a UUID'
```

## Command-line Flags

| Flag | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `--verbose` | Enable detailed output (shows tool parameters, results, token usage) |
| `--quiet` | Enable minimal output (only errors and final result) |
| `--no-color` | Disable colored output |
| `--no-emoji` | Disable emoji in output |
| `--config` | Path to config file (default: `~/.claude-proxy-config.json`) |

## Configuration

claude-proxy stores its configuration in `~/.claude-proxy-config.json`. The file is created automatically on first run.

### Example Configuration

```json
{
  "claudePath": "/usr/local/bin/claude",
  "defaultVerbosity": "normal",
  "colorEnabled": true,
  "emojiEnabled": true
}
```

### Configuration Options

| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|--------|------|---------|-------------|
| `claudePath` | string | (auto-detected) | Path to Claude CLI executable |
| `defaultVerbosity` | string | `"normal"` | Default verbosity level: `"quiet"`, `"normal"`, or `"verbose"` |
| `colorEnabled` | boolean | `true` | Enable colored output |
| `emojiEnabled` | boolean | `true` | Enable emoji indicators |

## Output Modes

### Normal Mode (default)

Shows real-time progress with tool indicators:

```
Starting Claude...
Reading file main.go
Running command: go build
Writing file output.txt
Hello! I've completed the task.

Session complete: 3 turns, 5.2s total (4.1s API), $0.02
```

### Verbose Mode (`--verbose`)

Shows detailed information including tool parameters, results, and token usage:

```
Starting Claude...
[Session] ID: abc123, Model: claude-sonnet-4-20250514
Reading file main.go
  path: /home/user/project/main.go
  result: (178 lines)
Running command: go build
  command: go build -o app .
  result: exit code 0
...
[Tokens] Input: 1,234 | Output: 567 | Cache Read: 890
```

### Quiet Mode (`--quiet`)

Minimal output for scripts - only shows errors and final result:

```
Starting...
Hello! I've completed the task.
Done
```

## Example Output

<!-- TODO: Add screenshot showing claude-proxy in action -->

*Screenshot placeholder: Example showing claude-proxy running with colored output and progress indicators*

## Requirements

- Claude CLI must be installed and accessible in your PATH
- Get Claude CLI from: https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-cli

## License

MIT

content.text: claude-proxy is a cross-platform CLI wrapper for Claude CLI that provides real-time progress feedback with colored output and emoji indicators during headless execution.

result: claude-proxy is a cross-platform CLI wrapper for Claude CLI that provides real-time progress feedback with colored output and emoji indicators during headless execution.
